list.title: Jr. Full Stack Developer in Solaris Development, Martico Group
list.description: This was my first professional experience in a software company. I work here as a full stack developer in a big project developed with Vue-Node-Express-MySQL. Here I work in new developments and code maintenance, this includes: 1- Data Base (modify and create tables, modify and create SQL views, write complex SQL queries) 2- Back End (modify and create Node-Express endpoints, creation of complex controllers that process a lot of information) 3- Front End (We don't have UI/UX designers so this includes not only the development but also the design of new functionalities, and even sometimes meetings with clients).

list.title: Freelance Full Stack Developer
list.description: During this period I waroked in a three programers team in an interesting project for a client. Client was a shoes retailer with three fisical stores in different locations, so he wanted to manage stocks and sales with one system, integrating all the information. I worked developing the Front End in React. I left that project to take my possition in Solaris Development.

list.title: Student in Rolling Code School
list.description: I took this time to learn the bases to start my new career as a developer. In this course I made my first steps in this world and it fascinated me from the very start.

list.title: Maintenance Manager Engineer in Siempre Verde S.A.
list.description: I had diferent positions and responsabilities in this company trhow these years. As the details are not relevant for my new ocupation (Software Devloper) I can sum up this experience saying that was incredibly enriching, with sacriifice, mistakes, achievements, and big resposibilities that involved considerable ammounts of money and resources of the company. Here I learned a lot about team working and team leading. (If you want to see more details about these years check out my LinkedIn profile).

list.title: Engineering Intern in AB InBev, Quilmes Beer Brewing Company
list.description: It was my first professional experience, I was close to finishing my engineering studies and this was my internship.
